Content:: One-day races and Classics Patrick Konrad (born 13 October 1991) is an Austrian racing cyclist, who currently rides for UCI WorldTeam Bora–Hansgrohe.[4] Born in MÃ¶dling, Konrad finished 4th in the 2014 Tour of Austria for Gourmetfein–Simplon Wels, winning the young rider classification. He joined Bora–Argon 18 for the 2015 season,[5] and he was named in the start list for the 2016 Tour de France[6] and the start list for the 2017 Giro d'Italia.[7] In 2018 he won the mountains classification at the Tour de Pologne,[8] and finished seventh overall at the Giro d'Italia.[9] In 2019 he won the Austrian National Road Race Championships and placed 3rd in the Tour de Suisse.[10] In the 2020 Giro d'Italia, held in October instead of May due to the COVID-19 pandemic in Italy, he finished in eighth place overall.[11] In 2021, Konrad won his first stage at a Grand Tour, winning a hilly stage 16 of the Tour de France; he also won the stage's combativity award.[12] As a result, he became the third Austrian rider to win a stage at the Tour de France, after Max Bulla in 1931 and Georg Totschnig in 2005.[13] He is the son of the organiser of the Vienna City Marathon and former middle-distance runner Wolfgang Konrad.[14]
